name: Moonweaver's Dawn
desc: An immaculate, sharp silver sword that can slice through armor like moonlight flowing through the empty night. According to legend, it is a divine blade, blessed by the first Moonchanter herself.

value.name: Echoes of an Unfinished Past
value.desc: You run into Vernadska, the self-proclaimed priestess, again on Hiisi Island. This time, she's trying to get into a sanctum...

value.text: Increases Elemental Burst DMG by <color=#37ffff>20%/25%/30%/35%/40%</color> . When the equipping character's Energy Capacity does not exceed 60/40, their Elemental Burst DMG is increased by an additional <color=#37ffff>16%/28%</color> | <color=#37ffff>20%/35%</color> | <color=#37ffff>24%/42%</color> | <color=#37ffff>28%/49%</color> | <color=#37ffff>32%/56%</color> .

desc.text:
"As you have always known, my Aila — my heart's child, my dearest, my most beloved,"
"In our blood flows the purest silver light, and we alone are worthy to receive the grace of the Frost Moon."
"You shall not wed the son of an outlander, for you are destined to bear the heir to Elysium for the people of the far north."
"The mistress of the Frost Moon has already spun every path in the world with her silver thread, and all things now move in step with the thread's silent dance."
Those were the days before the pitch-black calamity swept through the borderlands, when the Archpriestess of the far north repeated her blasphemous and misguided deeds in vain.
Perhaps out of excessive devotion to the gods, or because she had never believed in dead gods who had never shed their light upon the world,
(There was, after all, no real difference between the two. Her grandmother, who had raised her, certainly never distinguished between them.)
The young handmaiden, with unwavering faithfulness, carried out every last one of the venerable Archpriestess's commands.
She never defied that kind and gentle old grandmother, no matter how dreadful the punishments cloaked by her soft words.
Whether someone's thread was to be severed by a sharp silver blade, or another's singing voice must be silenced in the dead of night,
All sins were borne to purify the holy blood bestowed by the moon, for only by drinking crimson water could one hone absolute flawlessness.
"As you have always done, my Aila — my heart's child, my dearest, my most beloved,"
"Since he has put his trust in you, use your wisdom to guide him. Set his heart on the right path and lead him to the sanctuary."
"The man called Solovei is nothing but a treacherous murderer, and yet, he dares to seek our protection after all the wicked deeds he has committed."
"When he comes here, you will thrust your sword through his heart from behind to sever his venomous thread."
The only response the Archpriestess got, as ever and always, was silence, and those accustomed to silence from their followers always wind up taking it for consent.
The handmaiden's lengthy years of obedience had long convinced the Archpriestess that all that suffering brought on by impurity had never once stirred resentment in her.
But of course. She was the blessed one. The one destined to bear the Sacred Heir. Of course, she understood that the sacrifices she offered up were in service of a decree a thousand years in the making.
So, even as the pure silver blade pierced her back, the last Archpriestess of the far north could not comprehend the source of the betrayal.
"Heh... Mr. Solovei was right. You were just lying to us, Grandma Lovia."
"If that were not the case... why would you bleed dawn-light crimson, rather than moonlit silver, when your thread was cut?"

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Sundered Glory of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
It is told that in the years before the country of gold and white stone sank, the moon-worshipping ancestors were guided by the star of dawn to build a tower reaching to the heavens.
Later on, the most transgressive of wild fantasies, one to unify life and the world into one, one that even the monarch who ruled all nations on earth failed to achieve, was toppled along with the city in the wrath of the high heavens.
The homeless survivors fled to the south by the waning light of the Frostmoon, chanting in tears of a glory that belonged to them millennia ago.

materials.name: Lightless Bone
materials.desc:
A dull piece of bone taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
It is a fragment from the exoskeleton of a monster infused with the ancient power of the moon. Along with the vanished light, it has also lost the secrets once hidden within.

materials.name: Broken Drive Shaft
materials.desc:
The drive shaft of a Landcruiser destroyed in battle.
Even the most precise craftsmanship cannot withstand excessive wear, just as the most lofty ideals cannot bring back those who've died in vain for someone else's cause. Moreover, mass-produced components can hardly be called precise, and mass-produced ideals can hardly be considered true ideals.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Unyielding Delusion of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The grand city of gold and white stone was no more. Following the moonlight's pale guidance, its exiled inhabitants wandered to a desolate foreign land.
The glory and prowess of the past had dried up like morning dew, yet the earliest delusion still flowed beneath the skin of the proud, unlike the graves now lost to time.
Like farmers breeding their crops, the Archpriestesses who served the moonlight, for generation after generation, selected the purest bloodlines closest to their progenitors, no matter the cost...

materials.name: Lightless Bone
materials.desc:

materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The grand city of gold and white stone was no more. Following the moonlight's pale guidance, its exiled inhabitants wandered to a desolate foreign land.
The glory and prowess of the past had dried up like morning dew, yet the earliest delusion still flowed beneath the skin of the proud, unlike the graves now lost to time.
Like farmers breeding their crops, the Archpriestesses who served the moonlight, for generation after generation, selected the purest bloodlines closest to their progenitors, no matter the cost...

materials.name: Glowing Remains
materials.desc:
A faintly glowing piece of bone taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
It is the remains of an exoskeleton in which a vestige of the ancient power of the moon still lingers. It emanates a deep hue that still lingers long after being separated from its body, steeped as it is in the power of the moon.

materials.name: Reinforced Drive Shaft
materials.desc:
The reinforced drive shaft of a Landcruiser.
It took countless reports of destruction to bring about this insignificant improvement. In a sense, the administrative system of the Royal Armory Palace is several times more complex than the machinery it builds. After all, even the most advanced Landcruisers don't take months or even years to build.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Oblation of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
A blade as pure as moonlight is the compassion of a benevolent hand.
In the name of mercy, all beings offer hope for tomorrow. Even those looking to be made whole can feel the moonlight's pristine blessing flowing beneath their skin. Even the smallest blessings, accumulated, can guide the pious scions immersed in them closer to the coming Elysium.
All sins and wicked thoughts are cleansed by the pristine moonlight, all tears and suffering are necessary sacrifices — at least that is what the people who worship the moon once firmly believed.

materials.name: Glowing Remains
materials.desc:
A faintly glowing piece of bone taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
It is the remains of an exoskeleton in which a vestige of the ancient power of the moon still lingers. It emanates a deep hue that still lingers long after being separated from its body, steeped as it is in the power of the moon.

It took countless reports of destruction to bring about this insignificant improvement. In a sense, the administrative system of the Royal Armory Palace is several times more complex than the machinery it builds. After all, even the most advanced Landcruisers don't take months or even years to build.

materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Oblation of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

In the name of mercy, all beings offer hope for tomorrow. Even those looking to be made whole can feel the moonlight's pristine blessing flowing beneath their skin. Even the smallest blessings, accumulated, can guide the pious scions immersed in them closer to the coming Elysium.
All sins and wicked thoughts are cleansed by the pristine moonlight, all tears and suffering are necessary sacrifices — at least that is what the people who worship the moon once firmly believed.

materials.name: Radiant Exoskeleton
materials.desc:
A giant piece of bone that glows coldly, taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
These beasts blessed by the ancient power of the moon are able to manipulate their exoskeletons through the light that has soaked into their marrow over long years. Even though their bones float apart from their bodies, they can still command them at will like any other physical part.

materials.name: Precision Drive Shaft
materials.desc:
The drive shaft of a Landcruiser refined by the Design Bureau.
On the blueprints drawn by the engineers of the north, this unassuming part was once the flawless embodiment of glory and technological advancement, its small metal body encapsulating the wisdom of countless generations. Now it lies in the cold dirt, waiting to be recycled once more.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Aureate Radiance of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
With the unblessed birth of the prophesied son, a millennia-long plan ushered in a bleak twilight.
A scheme born of cunning was shattered by foolish betrayal. The youth who was supposed to be king took the maid who was supposed to serve him and stole the secret treasure that was supposed to be his, only to reject the crowns that fate had ordained for him.
In time, the king who was destined to rule Elysium went down in history as an unpardonable thief, and by the time the true new moon shone upon the land, the far north's final wish of golden grandeur had already been buried by a priestess, who had never believed in any god, in the empty grave of her king.

materials.name: Radiant Exoskeleton
materials.desc:
